meanings.definition: Disgusted or sickened by an excess of something, especially food or sweetness.
meanings.sent1: After eating too much candy, I felt cloyed and uncomfortable.
meanings.sent2: The overly sweet dessert left me feeling cloyed and queasy.
meanings.sent3: The cloyed look on his face after tasting the sugary drink was priceless.
meanings.sent4: The air in the room was so cloyed with perfume that it made my head spin.
meanings.sent5: The cloyed taste of the syrup lingered in my mouth long after I had finished eating.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel disgusted or sickened by an excess of something.
meanings.sent1: The rich cake cloyed her palate, making her regret eating so much.
meanings.sent2: The overwhelming smell of the flowers cloyed her senses, making her feel ill.
meanings.sent3: He tried to cloy her with compliments, but she saw through his flattery.
meanings.sent4: The constant praise began to cloy her, and she started to doubt its sincerity.
meanings.sent5: The never-ending chatter of her coworker cloyed her patience, causing her to seek solitude.

meanings.definition: To become overly sweet or sentimental.
meanings.sent1: The movie's ending was so cloyed with emotion that it made me roll my eyes.
meanings.sent2: The speech started to cloy with excessive praise, losing its impact.
meanings.sent3: Her attempts to cloy him with affection only made him feel suffocated.
meanings.sent4: The story became cloyed with unrealistic plot twists, losing its charm.
meanings.sent5: The dessert was delicious at first, but then it began to cloy with its sugary sweetness.
